snippet: Officials have blamed the Islamic State for the attack in which dozens were killed, and raids and arrests have been carried out across the country....
abstract: Turkish authorities say three suicide bombers responsible for Istanbul Airport attack that killed 44 people were Russian-speaking Islamic State fighters from former Soviet states; attack would be first external operation on Western target by such forces, which have been highly effective on battlefield in Iraq and Syria.

byline.original: By CEYLAN YEGINSU and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu reported from Istanbul, and Rukmini Callimachi from Paris. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Officials have blamed the Islamic State for the attack in which dozens were killed, and raids and arrests have been carried out across the country.

headline.main: Turkey Says Airport Bombers Were From Kyrgyzstan, Russia and Uzbekistan
headline.print_headline: Turkey Says Airport Bombers Were From Ex-Soviet States

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
